CatDescriptText: K.A. Messer, R.D. 1, Washington, PA, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 27, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think there is any racial tension in Pittsburgh? in neighborhood where you live?  If so, what do you think causes it?" answer reads: "I don't believe that there is.  In fact, in my opinion, there is none whatever.  I don't live in Pittsburgh, but I work here every day, however."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of K.A. Messer, wearing dark necktie with light colored design, and jacket with pens in left breast pocket, holding smoking pipe, standing on Wood Street with Raab Clothes and Dimlings Candy in background, Downtown
